content: First, support is offered here whether the individual donates or not. Unfortunately, the great majority do not. I reviewed your prior questions and - just a guess - it may be that you write lots of words in your request, but never give any information useful in helping you. Such as error messages, account setup information for incoming and outgoing. Knowing that doesn't guaranteed a solution, but it is a big help. There are too few here to respond to all problems, and the need to continually prompt for information tends to send us to work with those who give information up front. So, please share some details. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: Thank you David for your prompt response. I run a small online business I get about 60 emails a day. I did some research and discovered that Thunderbird no longer is funded by the Mozilla foundation. That's bad news. My ISP, that I have I have been using since 2010. That ISP is Wide Open West in Denver, CO. Now to save money they have done a deal with Synacor in Buffalo, NY to handle all of their email. They have had problems with email for a long time. I tried calling them and got a senior tech, but they sussed me out. Suddenly they asked, are you a end user. I said yes and they said that they could not talk to end users. So I may be changing my ISP soon. I have been working on this for 5 days today. I have been brought to rage and tears during that time. I have been uninstalling Thunderbird. I have been reinstalling Thunderbird reverting the releases for Thunderbird (all those files were in my downloaded in that very file going back in time - no joy there. Full disclosure, I am running MS 7 64bit professional, in a desktop that I built. Still MS sends me updates on the second Tuesday of every month. Usually a security rollup but lately they threw me MS Edge. This is a good machine. Now I really needed email so I decided to buy MS office but office has gotten so bad, I researched last known good Office, which is 2016. And I was able to purchase that at discount. So I clicked on outlook and with no setup was in business. So I will be expunging Thunderbird using MS uninstall and then going to Program files to remove any mention of Thunderbird and finally using a utility will remove any registry entry pertaining to Thunderbird. Thank you very much. Please enjoy your life but don't get old. All the best to you, Mike PS - there is still a problem with Synacor, they don't have a valid digital certificate.
creator: macme

content:
First, it is true that Thunderbird isn't funded by Mozilla. And that's the good news. Thunderbird is now MUCH better funded and has a hired staff doing development. There was gossip some years back that Thunderbird would die afterwards, but it has blossomed significantly. New release updates come out routinely, as do new enhancements.

Second, you continued to write a lot of words, yet never explained what your difficulties were. No one can help when they don't know the symptoms or error messages. Please mark this 'solved', as you have decided to solve this by transitioning to Office. I wish you well.
creator: davidsk

content:
Ciao, questo è solo un forum di utenti che Mozilla mette a disposizione di chi usa i suoi programmi. Questo significa che le risposte che eventualmente ricevi arrivano da altri utenti come te e non sono risposte ufficiali di Mozilla.

Detto questo, per quel che ne so, l'unico strumento utile si trova nel pulsante Seleziona le colonne da mostrare, in alto a destra in cima all'elenco delle email. Da lì si può usare il comando Visualizza le stesse colonne anche per... per applicare lo stessa visualizzazione della cartella corrente ad altre cartelle. Non mi risultano invece opzioni per un default applicabile automaticamente alle nuove cartelle.
creator: @next

... ma, se non ci sono alternative, farò le cose manualmente come ho fatto fino ad ora

Riccardo

PS: l'idea mi è venuta quando ho visto - ed utilizzato - la possibilità di modificare il registro di configurazione (ad esempio per impostare che le date siano dal più recente al più vecchio e non come preimpostato in TB dal più vecchio al più recente)

content:
Jonathon said
This is a Wish List item but I can't locate where to place it ;-)
https://connect.mozilla.org/ The link is also on the Thunderbird help menu under "feedback".

On the basis that I have Folders for Companies and Individuals based on their email addresses, I require different signatures for each Folder. This was a feature in the Virtual Access email software, where when a folder was the 'active' or highlighted folder, you used the 'Signature' icon or menu option, whereby you created the 'Signature' for that particular folder. So for my friends my signature was 'All best, Jonathon' or for my family 'Love, Dad' or 'Love, Jonathon' for acquaintances or companies, a signature that included my address and contact numbers.

But I am guessing if you use the signature switch addon your needs will be met. https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/signature-switch/?src=ss

content: Do you still have the backup? If a full backup, the folders should be there. However, if the backup was run while Thunderbird was running, then it's possible that folders are missing in the backup. If the folders are not in the backup, they're gone.

content:
Okay, here would be where to look. I'm assuming in my example that old drive appears as drive D. - open Windows Explorer with Thunderbird NOT running. - d:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles.ini is a text file that shows name of the profile. - the profile would be in 

 d:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles\<profilename>\Mail and/or Imapmail. Local folders would be in the Mail folder.

content: If you have access to the old drive, the folders you mentioned should be at the drive's root\users\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles\<profilename> and private folders in the Mail\local folders area. On your suggestion, the Thunderbird folder is stored in the appdata area because Windows recommends that area be for application data files, and version 102 now has built-in ability to export and import profiles.
creator: davidsk

content: Is this with a gmail or outlook.com account? Both copy sent messages to the Sent Mail or Sent folder automatically, so 'Place a copy in' must be unchecked in the Copies & Folders section of Account Settings.

content: Seeing screenshots of your smtp server settings and of your account settings may help. What you're describing could be a mistyped email id in account settings or an identity defined.
creator: davidsk

content:
If gmail account A is sending through the smtp server that has gmail account B's credentials, gmail will automatically swap A's credentials for those of B, so the recipient sees messages as if they were sent from the B account. The solution is to have separate smtp servers for each account, and to set the accounts to use the correct smtp server.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1350593
creator: sfhowes

But it's certainly something to explore as I am at a total loss. And Thank You for the reply!

content:
Okay! I think we solved it! When I go into Thunderbird Account Settings - Outgoing Server (SMTP), there are 6 choices saying Google Mail - smtp.gmail All of them seem correct when I looked at Edit SMTP server.

There are actually 6 email addresses from gmail in Thunderbird. When I looked at each - they were on different choices except the two that I was having issues with which were on the same choice and one choice with nothing.

So I followed the obvious logic and changed the problem email to the one choice that nothing was chosen for --- and it seems to be working correctly!

Thank You so very much, Guru Wizard! I would have never guessed this in a million years (well maybe in a few weeks. Months? But after many, many hours)

Now can you tell me how to get folders in color as the old defunct extension used to do?  ;)

content: You don't need Gmail to use Thunderbird, but you do need an email account if you wish to use Thunderbird as an email client. If your friend has a Gmail account that they use for their email communications, then you can't skip Gmail and just use Thunderbird for email. As an email client, Thunderbird needs to connect an actual email account to retrieve and send emails. That account doesn't have to be a Gmail account. You can use pretty much any email service other than Gmail. Thunderbird is NOT an email service like Gmail. It's just a client that you use to manage your emails as provided by an email service such as Gmail, Yahoo, Outlook etc.
creator: stancestans

content:
vladd1 said
I can't get his contacts to show up in the sidebar which he really likes,

I am guessing that is in the compose windows. The shortcut is F9 to toggle the contacts sidebar as it is described on the menu.

put the folders in the sidebar in the right order,

Probably supported by this addon. https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/manually-sort-folders/ As addons often need to be updated after a Thunderbird version upgrade you might want to teach the individual to look at addons post update to see if they are still enabled.

figure out why the gmail folder is in the sidebar, etc. Is there a way to skip gmail and just use Thunderbird (Mozilla?) for email?

Entering [Gmail] in the server directory in account settings > server settings > advanced will suppress the same named folder in a gmail IMAP account. But as Thunderbird is email client getting mail for existing email accounts, and aggregating them when appropriate, there is an intrinsic link to the email provider (for example GMail) and the data in Thunderbird. Thunderbird does not supply the email address used, that is done by the email provider.
creator: MattAuSupport
